channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various issues along kirk lane as always, 15th November
item.description:
Overflowing abandoned bin near isla road entrance off kirk lane; along kirk lane there are loads of gas canisters and bag full of garden waste.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plum Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic waste contractor leaving wheely bins on the footway as an obstruction and eyesore fronting 38-60 Lennard Rd Penge even number houses, 15th November
item.description:
Domestic waste contractor leaving wheely bins on the footway as an obstruction and eyesore fronting 38-60 Lennard Rd Penge even number houses (with two wheel parking too). The bins were empty so they were left there by the contractor. Photos Friday 14/11/25 at about 1.10pm.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bench not put back on steep hill by 1, Glassmill Lane / entry to Church House Gardens, 15th November
item.description:
There used to be a wooden bench on the public footway, by 1 Glassmill Lane, Bromley, near the lower gate to Church House Gardens. I reported that it was damaged about a year ago. I presume it was removed for repair but it has not been put back. Please put the bench back. It is a very steep hill and old people with breathing problems, hop pain and joint aches, such as myself need it to rest. There is a second bench but that is nearly at the top of the hill. This one was halfway up the steep hill and is really needed. There is no FMS category for footway benches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lovelace Road SE21 opposite side of the roa, 15th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Lovelace Road, Tulse Hill, London Borough of Lambeth

item.title: Footpath wall is unsafe, 15th November
item.description:
The wall along the footpath from the Warwick Road allotments to Sidcup place is leaning dangerously over and looks like it could fall at any time! Bearing in mind the recent tragedy at the golf course I wanted to raise this as each time Iâ€™ve walked past it seems to be leaning further over towards the pathway. This could cause serious injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Road, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Locked and chained gate obstructing the byway, 15th November
item.description:
I was trapped on this byway and was only able to escape as a gentleman helped lift my wheelchair late at night. As a vulnerable woman I am concerned as to why this gate is able to lock on a byway forcing those in wheelchairs to be trapped. Direct Gov are very clear that byways must be accessible to all forms of transport.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Crayford, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waldenshaw Road, Forest Hill, Sydenham, London Borough of Lewisham

item.title: Forest bike left in middle of pedestrian only space. Datchelor Place, 15th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Datchelor Place, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
